name: O'Callaghan Hotel Annapolis

reviews.title: Irish Hospitality
reviews.text: I was in Annapolis on business and chose O'Callaghan for the value and location. I was treated with utmost respect and courtesy from the moment of my arrival until I checked out. They even allowed me to leave my car in their garage after check-out while I was in my meeting.

reviews.title: "My only place to stay in Annapolis"
reviews.text: The reason I rated the service a four really has more to do with a convenience issue that a service issue, but no other category fit. I went to the business center in the evening to get a soda, and the soda machine was inoperative. Otherwise, everything was perfect! I believe they say in Ireland, go raibh maith agaibh - thank you all for making my stay memorable. I will definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: Pleased with our experience
reviews.text: I am very particular as to where I spend my nights away from home.In this hotel I found great value along with extra clean rooms(a must with me).The location was not right "down town but a short walk puts you in the center of everything.After a day of sightseeing and shopping the bar is a perfect place to wind down.

reviews.title: Cozy hotel with luxury and great location to downtown!
reviews.text: After some negative reviews I read I was nervous but must say was pleasantly surprised and very pleased with our experience at the O'Callaghan. All staff we encountered with very professional, attentive and courteous. No complaints from us whatsoever other than painfully slow internet.

reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.text: This was a great clean, beautiful hotel with friendly and efficient staff. The location was great and would definitely go back and/or recommend to friends/family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Found this hotel on TripAdvisor for a one night stay picking my son up from camp. The price was great, and I suggested the hotel to a friend who was bringing kids to camp. Location is very good, walking distance to all. They have a free shuttle and will drop you off and pick you up when you call for a ride, which is very nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Don't think I would book this hotel for a vacation, but for one night, it was perfect.
reviews.title: Good choice
Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.text: First time visitors to Annapolis, and this town was recommended as a "one tank trip". We booked here as price was mid-range. Not sure what we would discover, but it was clean, staff was very helpful and friendly and for the money - it was well worth it. Bar area and breakfast was very nice. Complimentary shuttle was great, as we did quite a bit of walking. Had considered more expensive places to stay - but was glad I didn't! - was just right for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is by far the best place to stay in annapolis. very clean, great location, very friendly..everyone welcomes you as if they known you all your life..when you check in they are very polite & go out of their way to make you feel welcome. the rooms are nicely decorated & have all the amenities you need. the bar off the lobby is like being at "cheers" the bartender gets everyone involved in conversations with each other & laughing you don't want the night to end. the food is very tasty & they make sure you are happy with your selection. room service is better then any 5 star hotel i ever stayed. i called for more pillows & they were there in less the 5 minutes.. valet had the car in front before we even got downstairs.. sally hughes is the general manager & she is one of the sweetest, nicest people you can meet. she runs a very classy hotel & she is very hands on with everything. i will be going back again real soon & will only stay at this hotel..you can't go wrong..
reviews.title: 5 stars all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I needed a place to stay while attending the Annapolis Sailing School. This place was less than 5 miles away from the marina, which is why we focused in on this resort.
reviews.title: Great location and very nice staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lucky for us, they were offering a summer special, so the value was an added bonus.
reviews.title: Nice choice

likes.liked: — Small, private European feel at reasonable prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: $50 from priceline over Easter weekend.
reviews.title: 2 Queen size bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Family leisure travel (2 adults and 4 kids under age 9)
reviews.title: Ok stay, but there are better choices in Annapolis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Will stay here every time I visit Annapolis

likes.liked: — Very friendly staff, Very clean comfortable rooms, Excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -2 queen size beds rather than fulls or doubles (nice when you have to share a bed with little kids who turn and move around alot at night)
reviews.title: What a Great New Year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -complimentary shuttle (we were tired walking around and still needed to get somewhere and the desk guy gave me and my 4 kids a ride back downtown)
reviews.title: Would return to O'Callaghan's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights over the 4th of July holiday weekend and had a very pleasant stay. We stayed in a room with one queen bed, and the room was of adequate size, comfortable, clean, and nicely appointed. The small refrigerator in the room was a convenient bonus. (Note: I noticed that other reviewers have complained about minor things like the view or the air conditioning. Yes, our window had a view of an alley, but if we'd wanted a great view, we would've paid for an upgrade or stayed at a waterfront hotel. We didn't care about the view because we didn't plan to spend an extensive amount of time in the room, and it suited our needs just fine. The A/C worked just fine, except for the time when I screwed it up through operator error, at which point I called the front desk and they sent someone up to correct the problem right away. There is a normal TV, not a super new flat screen, but again, this is not something we care about as long as it works, which it did and was a good size. No complaints.) The front desk staff were also friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good value in downtown Annapolis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is great, as it's within easy walking distance of most places of interest in downtown Annapolis, including the shops of Main Street and the waterfront. West Street itself, on which the hotel is located, also has some nice restaurants, pubs, shops and galleries within a couple blocks of the hotel. We didn't pay for parking, as we lucked out and got free street parking right in front of the hotel (and the usual 2-hour restriction didn't apply because of it being a Sunday followed by a holiday), but we saw the reasonably-priced private garage just a half-block down the street, which we would've used instead of the more expensive valet parking if not for our luck with the street parking. Valet parking might be a good option for those who plan to use their car regularly, though, since apparently the garage down the street charges every time you take your car out of the garage, whereas the hotel's valet parking is a flat rate. All in all, we had no complaints with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. For the reasonable price compared to other downtown hotels, O'Callaghan exceeded our expectations and is a very good value for the combination of convenient location and comfortable accommodations.
reviews.title: what a wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For places to go in Annapolis outside of the hotel, we would highly recommend Hell Point Seafood near the city dock for high quality food and drinks in a nice atmosphere. We were thrilled to find this place (which is one of Washingtonian magazine's top 100 restaurants) as an alternative to some of the more touristy places around the waterfront that were not very appealing. For drinks in town, we enjoyed the historic but casual setting of Sly Fox Pub, just off the main traffic circle, and Ram's Head Tavern not far from the hotel on West St., which had live music. We had a very good, inexpensive lunch at 49 West, the coffee shop/wine bar/gallery that's just down West St. from the hotel. Finally, we particularly loved Davis' Pub, tucked away off the beaten path in Eastport, across the drawbridge from downtown, which we found thanks to the recommendation of a local -- a great casual spot for drinks that has a beachy, friendly, neighborhood vibe; we also enjoyed some big peel & eat shrimp and delicious crab dip at one of their outdoor picnic tables with a partial view of the water. As for shopping, Main St. offers a number of places that are fun to browse. Ladies, for reasonably priced and stylish jewelry, handbags, and a small selection of clothing, check out Lilac Bijoux near the waterfront on Main. Lastly, if you're not lucky enough to have your own boat (which we weren't), to get out on the water try a sailing cruise with Schooner Woodwind Cruises, which was informative, fun, and relaxing with a friendly crew and - a nice surprise - a good selection of microbrews to enjoy on board (they also have wine).
reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while my son was at the naval academy soccer camp. The room was excellent (ask for a balcony), plenty of room for my daughter and I. The staff was so kind to us and gave us a map each day and pointed us in the right direction. Thank you Jackie! Jacque was also so sweet, she told us to go on a pirate adventure ship, and my 5 year old daughter loved it! A must see if you have young children. Garrett was a doll! He guided us to the best beach!!! Thank you!!! but my biggest thanks goes to Ronnie who helped me get back across the bay bridge after i freaked out (major fear of heights) and couldn't drive back. She got me in touch with a shuttle service that drove my car back; Without her i would have driven almost to Delaware to get back. We just felt so welcomed. Great hotel and awesome staff!
reviews.title: Met our Needs Perfectly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was exactly what we wanted. It was close enough to downtown that we could walk - had a lot of nearby restaurants. There was a special and we got the balcony which was great - had our morning coffee and evening cocktail out there and it was great. Room was very clean and we did have a flatscreen TV so we were one of the lucky ones I guess. We forgot toothpaste and the hotel provided it for us and it was quickly brought to the room. Had a restaurant and bar also. We did not use the restaurant but we did have a nightcap at the bar. There was a wedding group and the bar was crowded but we were served right away. We received great service from everyone (valet, front desk, bar/restaurant and maid service. If we are every in Annapolis again we will definitely return and will recommend this hotel to any of our family or friends.
reviews.title: Here for a wedding..It was just an okay hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We checked in Friday. The valet and bellhop were very courteous and helpful. We went up to the room and it was uncomfortable. The air condition like the rest of the room was real old and did not work well and kept going off. The TV was probably twenty years old. It does not cost much to move into the future and equip all rooms with flat screen TV's. The bar was ok nothing special. There is also no pool. It is an average hotel and if you get a discount its not bad.
reviews.title: Good Service but Old Hotel Rooms and bad air conditoning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family the night before my first 10k...definitely a good idea. The staff was very friendly, valet parking was avail but reduced-fare parking was very close by, the room was immaculate, the pillows and bed were very comfortable, and little refrig and coffee pot in room were great!
reviews.title: Quiet, clean, and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I slept like a baby and woke up feeling great for my run. It was less than a mile walk to Navy Marine Corp Memorial Stadium (which was a perfect warm-up). After the race, a hot shower was fantastic!!! (and the water is reallllly nice and hot!!!)
reviews.title: nice but pricy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out was at 12 which is later than most places (perfect to shower after my morning race).
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Staff friendly & Helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only two negatives: ice maker on our floor was broken and view was facing the dumpster and employee lot. Neither mattered because I wasn't there for the view and ice was available in the lobby.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for a quick weekend getaway. Location is not right in the heart of Annapolis; an easy walk to a number of restaurants, shops and pubs, quite a hike to City Dock and USNA.
reviews.title: Huge, well-appointed rooms

likes.disliked: — Location near, but not in the heart of things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were HUGE, well appointed and well finished. Top notch. Staff is friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Nice Place, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: We had a fifth floor room, and I believe the ballroom was on the fourth. Could hear music from a wedding reception in the evening, albeit muffled. I found it pleasant and amusing, others may be annoyed.
reviews.title: Wonderful USNA Commisioning Week Stay for our large family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In hotel breakfast options limited to a somewhat pricey and limited buffet. Not much else open nearby, though a lot is being built.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was a great deal. The location is perfect-about a 1/2 mile from the harbor area-near the Westin and Lowes Hotel. We booked through Expedia and although it was in the middle of summer got a great rate for under $100.00 (weeknight). We had compared a few other hotels in the area and all were looking for $250 or if on the harbor (like the Marriott) over $300 per night.
reviews.title: A friendly hotel in a much improved environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was expecting a kinda run down older place considering the great price I paid of $120 per room for the three rooms I booked. I was very much wrong. The service was terrific. The beds were very comfortable. The place was clean and just plain nice. The only problem I had was the breakfast buffet. It was $8 and was very poorly stocked, and the food that was there was old and nasty. The bacon was overcooked. If you stay here, I recommend NOT eating the breakfast. The room service and dinner was very good the night before.
reviews.title: What a surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Easy access to all the city of Annapolis has to offer. Walk, ride the E-car, Circulator, no need for your own car once you have arrived. All services extended with smiles and efficiency. All guests loved the hotel and said they would like to return for a longer stay.
reviews.title: We brought 41 friends and family members together here. All loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Loved the hotel and staff! They were helpful when I had questions, and unfailingly polite. Room was comfortable and clean, although furnishings were slightly outdated. I slept soundly both nights I was there, and found it easy to get to other destinations and downtown Main Street from here, by walking and using free trolley services. Price was very reasonable, more than making up for any less-than-state-of-the-art amenities.
reviews.title: Quiet and comfy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Decent place and within a reasonable walk to the water front. They didn't give us another option for parking besides $18/night for valet which is pretty ridiculous, especially when I found out later that you can park in a public garage without a problem that is a block away. Also rate was steep for a fairly normal hotel. I'd look elsewhere if possible next time. First guy who checked us in wasn't particularly nice either. Oh, and no pool.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: O'Callaghan's is starting to look a little tired and slightly outdated round the edges. The room was clean, there was a (noisy) fridge, and there is free cabled Internet -- but the cable in my room has a broken connector and isn't much use with modern devices that don't have network sockets like iPads or iPhones.
reviews.title: Generally OK, but poor breakfast, no wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife chose the O'Callaghan Hotel in Annapolis, MD for a weekend stay for our third honeymoon. From reading the website and looking at the pictures, we both expected the hotel to be much nicer than it turned out to be. In fact, my wife booked the room in July for our October weekend and got an executive room at a less expensive rate than the hotel's normal booking rate for that same room. We specifically wanted a room with balcony access. Since the hotel only has 8 rooms with balcony rooms, we paid a little bit more though still a lot less than the normal rate. There are 4 executive rooms with balconies and 4 suites with large balcony/decks. We both liked the size of the room and thought it to be cozy. However, the carpet in the room was quite worn and dirty, and the fixtures both in the bathroom and in the room itself were cheap and worn. The sliding glass door was quite beat up and the carpet right inside the door was quite filthy. The king bed was firm though still quite comfortable. However, for such a large bed, we were only provided with 3 small pillows, an extremely thick and heavy comforter (quite possibly the heaviest comforter that I have ever felt), and a blanket. On the second night, we requested an additional pillow and blanket which the hotel provided rather quickly. The mini fridge was propped up on two pieces of wood, which looked rather cheap. The worst part of our stay was the room service breakfast. We both ordered the standard American breakfast (scrambled eggs, potatoes, toast, and bacon), however, when it showed up, there was no toast on either plate, no bacon on one plate, and the other plate had rather uncooked Canadian bacon, plus I had ordered scrambled eggs but received a western omelet, which was no big deal. Also, the potatoes were terrible...as if they had been sitting under hot lights in a breakfast bar for several hours. We couldn't even eat them because they were so hard. The eggs lacked any flavor, although I had the western omelet by mistake on their part and it had flavor only because of the peppers and onions. So moral of the story: eat out. We also were told that the ice machine didn't work properly when I went to fill up my small cooler with just a little bit of ice. Location-wise the hotel is just down the block from restaurants and shops on West St. and just a few minute walk to the harbor. The Loews is about a block away. The next time we return to Annapolis, we will likely stay closer to Main St. and the statehouse. For the 3 1/2 stars that the O'Callaghan claims to have, we expected a nicer, cleaner room and slightly more luxurious. They even show robes in the hotel pictures but there were no such items in the rooms.
reviews.title: Can Do Better

likes.liked: — Close proximity to restaurants, shops, and cultural attractions of Annapolis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The O'Callaghan is in a great location -- we went for the Navy football game, and it was an easy walk. Also within walking distance of plenty of restaurants and shops. However, we paid over $300/night, and the room was NOT up to expectations. The bathroom was dirty, the walls were nicked up and marked, we were not given a bathmat, soap for the bath, and lots of other little amenities one would expect for that price. We will stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight. Check in was quick, friendly & efficient. Room was spacious, clean, quiet and well-equipped. The cost of parking is reasonable compared with other places. The location is about 1 block away from Loew's Hotel where prices are almost triple, so the value at O'Callaghan's is good. It's about a 15 minute pleasant walk to the port & historic parts of town. Overall, we'd recommend it!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because it was suggested by the conference we were attending. We arrived at night and were concerned with the number of homeless individuals wandering around. We later found out there is a shelter for them close by. The employees at the hotel were extemely nice upon check-in and during our stay.
reviews.title: Could be nice if updated

likes.disliked: — The quality of the rooms and the safety of the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are good sized but needs to be updated. I could hear the person next to me, get out of bed, go to the bathroom and could hear the tv. The rooms are beginning to show signs of age. The drawers to one of my cabinets was falling apart and the extra lock on the door on the door was broke. The tv was very old, the speakers were bad and I couldn't get CBS at all. I did like having a safe in the room to keep belongings in.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with O'Callaghan's

description: A Warm Irish Welcome awaits you in Historic Annapolis! Make us your home while you explore all the great attractions of this great city. Walk to everything or use our free shuttle around the downtown area. All rooms offer free high speed internet. Enjoy a great happy hour in the John Barry Bar! Meetings, weddings and private events.
